citations.narrative:
There is no record for one male and one female sun conure that were donated in mid December, 2023, and a record was
completed at time of inspection for a rabbit that was donated December 25, 2023. Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and
maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information concerning animals other than dogs
and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her
control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall
include any offspring born or hatched of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control, to the extent
that any identification or counting of offspring can be carried out without unduly disturbing nesting or rearing activities.
Records for all animal acquisitions and dispositions must be kept and maintained. These records must include the name
and address from whom the animal was acquired, the USDA license of the person the animal was acquired or sold, the
date of purchase and the species of animal acquired.

There are two wooden grain feeders inside the shelter for the two dromedary camels and the two bactrian camels. The
camels have chewed the grain feeders exposing 3 screwheads on one feeder and one nail-head in the other feeder. The
nail and screwheads are approximately 1 1/2" tall. The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound
and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. Facilities must be
kept in good repair to ensure the animals in the enclosure do not ingest the nails or screws, or injure themselves on the
exposed nail and screwheads.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
There is no record for one male and one female sun conure that were donated in mid December, 2023, and a record was 
completed at time of inspection for a rabbit that was donated December 25, 2023. Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and 
maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information concerning animals other than dogs 
and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her 
control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall 
include any offspring born or hatched of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control, to the extent 
that any identification or counting of offspring can be carried out without unduly disturbing nesting or rearing activities. 
Records for all animal acquisitions and dispositions must be kept and maintained. These records must include the name 
and address from whom the animal was acquired, the USDA license of the person the animal was acquired or sold, the 
date of purchase and the species of animal acquired. 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
There are two wooden grain feeders inside the shelter for the two dromedary camels and the two bactrian camels. The 
camels have chewed the grain feeders exposing 3 screwheads on one feeder and one nail-head in the other feeder. The 
nail and screwheads are approximately 1 1/2" tall. The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound 
and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. Facilities must be 
kept in good repair to ensure the animals in the enclosure do not ingest the nails or screws, or injure themselves on the 
exposed nail and screwheads. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
